<<<<<<< HEAD
The mournfull shepherdesse of Arcadiah. Or, The solitary sollitudes of the matchlesse shepherdesse: whose earthly joy did shine with luster bright, but now's eclips'd, and turn'd to dismall night; The tune is, Tell me you wandring spirits, &c.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill (woodcuts).
Printed for Fran. Grove on Snow-hill., London : [1650?]
Date of publication from Wing. Verse: "Assist me muses with your power divine ..." In two parts, printed side by side. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
The mournfull shepherdesse of Arcadiah. Or, The solitary sollitudes of the matchlesse shepherdesse: whose earthly joy did shine with luster bright, but now's eclips'd, and turn'd to dismall night; The tune is, Tell me you wandring spirits, &c.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill (woodcuts).
Printed for Fran. Grove on Snow-hill., London : [1650?]
Date of publication from Wing. Verse: "Assist me muses with your power divine ..." In two parts, printed side by side. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
Fran. Grove
Snow-hill.
